Audit mode & reproducibility

Source: vignettes/audit-and-reproducibility.qmd

Why audit mode

Transparency matters — audit_mode = TRUE lets you capture model metadata, raw responses, and rationales.

Example 

df <- tibble(
  text = c("Increase in arrivals reported", "Shelter conditions improved")
)

df |>
  mutate(
    out = classify_llm(
      text,
      categories = c("Protection","Shelter","Health"),
      audit_mode = TRUE
    )
  ) |>
  tidyr::unnest_wider(out) |>
  select(text, label, rationale, model, ts)

Save an audit log 

df |>
  mutate(out = classify_llm(text, categories = c("A","B"), audit_mode = TRUE)) |>
  tidyr::unnest_wider(out) |>
  readr::write_csv("audit_log.csv")

Note

Reproducibility checklist - Record model and temperature - Pin provider versions where possible - Save timestamps and raw responses
